SCALES-DRP

More into the DRP Execution

The SCALES-DRP is intergrated with Keck DRP framework. The usable command lines are explained below.

Process files, file lists and entire directories

  • To reduce a single FITS file in a directory (make sure you are inside the directory where the filename.fits exist):

start_scales_reduce -f filename.fits

Here -f specifies file input and is followed by a file name

  • To reduce all FITS files in a directory one by one:

start_scales_reduce -d FULL PATH

Here -d specifies input file directory followed by the FULL PATH to the directory.

  • To reduce only a subset of the files (for example, a single object out of an entire observing run):

start_scales_reduce -l input_files.txt

Here -l specifies list input mode followed by a file with a list of raw image files (input_files.txt)

Note

Please note that all the preliminary calibration files needed to be reduced and avaialable in the data directory before reducing a science frame using the science-grad pipeline.

Other command line options

Master files created

Symbol

Meaning

Note

-g

group mode

Use group mode: separate files by image type and reduce in the correct order

-f

frame mode

single input file

-i

Input files

Pattern to match

-d

input directory name

give the full path

-l

list

file list

-m

monitor

Continue monitoring the directory after the initial ingestion

-I

ingest_data_only

Ingest data and terminate

-w

wait for an event

Continue processing wait for an event to a fixed time

-W

continuous

Continue processing wait for ever
